Now, the C code structure:

#include <stdio.h>

#include <string.h>

#include <stdbool.h>

int main() {

    // First step variables:

    int N;

    char **strings;

    bool ans = true;

    // Read N and the strings.

    scanf("%d", &N);

    strings = (char**)malloc(N * sizeof(char*));

    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {

        strings[i] = (char*)malloc(100 * sizeof(char)); // assuming max length per string is 100.

        scanf("%s", strings[i]);

    }

    // Check uniqueness:

    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {

        for (int j=i+1; j<N; j++) {

            if (strcmp(strings[i], strings[j]) ==0) {

                ans = false;

                break;

            }

        }

        if (!ans) break;

    }

    // Check the second condition:

    if (ans) {

        for (int i=1; i<N; i++) {

            const char *prev = strings[i-1];

            const char *curr = strings[i];

            if (prev[strlen(prev)-1] != curr[0]) {

                ans = false;

                break;

            }

        }

    }

    // Determine first step's result.

    char first_result[5]; // "Yes" or "No"

    strcpy(first_result, ans ? "Yes" : "No");

    // Second step processing:

    char second_char = first_result[0] +1;

    char second_result[2]; // to hold the character as a string.

    second_result[0] = second_char;

    second_result[1] = '\0';

    // Third step processing:

    // The input is the second_result string.

    const char *third_input = second_result;

    int len = strlen(third_input);

    int *digits = (int*)malloc( (len+1)*sizeof(int) );

    for (int i=0; i<=len; i++) {

        digits[i] = 0;

    }

    // Fill digits array:

    for (int i=0; i < len; i++) {

        int pos = len -1 -i;

        digits[i] = third_input[pos] - '0';

    }

    // Process the digits:

    long bills =0;

    for (int i=0; i <= len; i++) {

        if (digits[i] ==10) {

            digits[i+1]++;

            digits[i] =0;

        }

        if (digits[i] <5) {

            bills += digits[i];

        } else if (digits[i] ==5) {

            if (digits[i+1] >=5) {

                digits[i+1]++;

            }

            bills +=5;

        } else {

            digits[i+1]++;

            bills +=10 - digits[i];

        }

    }

    // Output the final result.

    printf("%ld\n", bills);

    // Free allocated memory.

    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {

        free(strings[i]);

    }

    free(strings);

    free(digits);

    return 0;

}
